title: Jeremy Kyle viewers STUNNED at what guest 'eating himself to death' has for breakfast as they label worried mum a hypocrite
text:

Jeremy Kyle viewers were SHOCKED at what a man “eating himself to death” has for breakfast on today’s show. 
Sue brought her son Jonathan on the ITV show, because she was so worried the 30-year-old father of one was sending himself to an early grave due to an addiction to food. 
She told Jeremy: “He’s never eaten vegetables, he’s tried every diet, and he’s had a personal trainer. 
“We’ve tried everything, we’ve spent nearly £15,000 of our retirement money on him. Read More Sue was worried about her son "eating himself to death" (Photo: ITV) Viewers were shocked by what Jonathan ate for breakfast (Photo: ITV) She's spent £15,000 on getting him better (Photo: ITV) (Photo: ITV) 
“He’s got a little boy. He shouldn’t go to his grave before me.” 
But the biggest shock came when his mum revealed his breakfast consists of two egg salad, salad cream rolls, pot noodle on toast, two toasted pate sandwiches and meatballs with three slices of bread and butter! 
However, many viewers accused Sue of being a hypocrite - considering she looked bigger than her son. 
Jeremy pointed out she wasn’t slim, which she put down to a disability, making her “unable to move”. 
But viewers weren’t convinced, with one saying: “Sorry but what disability stop her from loosing weight? Lead by example hon! (sic).” 
Another added: “Not being able to move, does not make you fat ... eating too many calories makes you fat #JeremyKyle.” Read More Jeremy pointed out she wasn't slim (Photo: ITV) Sue put it down to a disability (Photo: ITV) But viewers weren't convinced (Photo: ITV) Jonathan is going to boot camp now (Photo: ITV) 
A third added: “‘Help! My son is eating himself to death’ yer not a good f**king role model pal. Look at the size of you! #jeremykyle.” 
In the end, Jonathan got sent to a 12-week residential boot camp, where he’ll be taught to change his mindset on food, as well as exercise. 
Jonathan will be back on the show soon for viewers to find out the results.
